title: Companion Card Application: Complete Guide for Every Australian State (2025)
description: Everything you need to know about applying for a Companion Card in Australia. Step-by-step application guides for NSW, Victoria, Queensland, and all other states, including eligibility requirements, required documents, and where to use your card.
content:
What is a Companion Card?

A Companion Card is a nationally recognised card that allows people with significant and permanent disabilities to bring a companion or carer to venues and events free of charge. Instead of paying for two tickets, you pay for one—your companion gets in free.

The program recognises that some people with disability require attendant care support to participate in community activities, and that the cost of a second ticket shouldn't be a barrier to participation. Over 4,200 businesses and organisations across Australia accept the Companion Card, including cinemas, sporting venues, theatres, museums, zoos, and public transport services.

Who is Eligible for a Companion Card?

To be eligible for a Companion Card in any Australian state or territory, you must meet the following criteria:

Core Eligibility Requirements

  1. Australian Residency: You must be a permanent Australian citizen or resident
  2. Significant and Permanent Disability: You must have a significant disability that is permanent (lifelong)
  3. High Level of Support Needs: Your disability must require a high level of ongoing attendant care support to participate in community activities
  4. Lifelong Need: The need for attendant care support must be lifelong—not temporary or related to a condition that may improve

Important: NDIS eligibility does not guarantee Companion Card eligibility. The program is not income-tested—your eligibility is based purely on your support needs.

How to Apply: State-by-State Guide

New South Wales (NSW)

Phone: 1800 893 044

Processing Time: Up to 12 weeks

Visit Service NSW online to complete your application with supporting documentation.

Victoria (VIC)

Phone: 1800 650 611

Processing Time: Minimum 8 weeks

Apply online or download a hard copy form. Part A is completed by you, Part B by your health professional.

Queensland (QLD)

Phone: 13 QGOV (13 74 68)

Processing Time: 4-6 weeks

Complete the online application form on the Queensland Government website.

South Australia (SA)

Phone: 1800 667 110

Western Australia (WA)

Phone: 1800 617 337

Australian Capital Territory (ACT)

Phone: (02) 6205 4333

Tasmania (TAS)

Phone: 1800 009 501

Northern Territory (NT)

Phone: (08) 8948 5400

Required Documents

  • Completed Application Form (Part A by you, Part B by health professional)
  • Two passport-sized photographs (signed on back by health professional)
  • Proof of identity (driver's licence, passport, Medicare card)
  • Proof of residency
  • Supporting medical documentation (Functional Capacity Assessments, diagnostic reports, therapy reports)

Who Can Complete the Health Professional Section?

GP, Medical Specialist, Occupational Therapist, Physiotherapist, Psychologist, Social Worker, Registered Nurse, or NDIS Support Coordinator.

How Long is a Companion Card Valid?

Your Companion Card is a lifelong card. Once approved, you don't need to reapply—it simply needs to be renewed every 10 years to update your photograph and details.

Where Can You Use Your Companion Card?

The card is accepted at over 4,200 venues including:

  • Cinemas, theatres, and concert venues
  • Museums, galleries, and zoos
  • Sporting venues (AFL, NRL, cricket)
  • Public transport (buses, trains, ferries)
  • Theme parks and tourist attractions
  • Swimming pools and fitness centres

Your card is recognised nationally, so you can use it when travelling interstate.

Companion Card vs NDIS

The Companion Card and NDIS serve different purposes. The Companion Card provides free entry for companions at venues, while the NDIS provides funding for disability supports and services. You can have both! Having one doesn't affect your eligibility for the other.

Tips for a Successful Application

  1. Be detailed about your support needs
  2. Choose a health professional who knows your condition well
  3. Gather strong supporting documentation
  4. Don't assume NDIS means automatic approval
  5. Apply before you need it (processing takes 4-12 weeks)
